info.title: Customers
info.description: Provides methods for working with customer objects and data.

get.description:
Retrieves an array of Customers based on a valid parameter of choice.

Note: This API allows for multiple parameters, however only one parameter should be passed to the API at any given time, as only one will be honored.

You can get the **Request Parameters** at this call: - Get Customer **NOTE:** Do not include spaces between words. - Format: FirstnameLastname - Ex. SamSpace

parameters.name: backofficeid
parameters.description: The Back Office ID of the Customer(s) to retrieve.

parameters.name: externalreferenceid
parameters.description: The External Reference ID of the Customer(s) to retrieve.

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: The Email Address of the Customer(s) to retrieve.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: The Username of the Customer(s) to retrieve.

parameters.name: webalias
parameters.description: The Web Alias of the Customer(s) to retrieve.

200.description: Returns an array of valid Customer objects.

examples.application/json:
[
  {
    "CustomerId": 2,
    "BackOfficeId": "ABC123",
    "BirthDate": "1988-04-01T00:00:00.0000000+00:00",
    "CompanyName": "Test Company Name",
    "CustomerStatus": 1,
    "CustomerType": 1,
    "DefaultShippingAddress": {
      "AddressId": 15714,
      "Street1": "7432 Maytown Road",
      "Street2": "",
      "Street3": "",
      "City": "Springfield",
      "Region": "NT",
      "PostalCode": "49007",
      "CountryCode": "US"
    },
    "EmailAddress": "testing@testing.directscale.com",
    "EnrollerId": 2,
    "ExternalReferenceId": "TEST123",
    "FirstName": "TestFirst",
    "InactiveDate": "1900-01-01T00:00:00.0000000+00:00",
    "LanguageCode": "EN",
    "LastName": "TestLast",
    "PrimaryAddress": {
      "AddressId": 15714,
      "Street1": "7432 Maytown Road",
      "Street2": "",
      "Street3": "",
      "City": "Springfield",
      "Region": "NT",
      "PostalCode": "49007",
      "CountryCode": "US"
    },
    "PrimaryPhone": "+1 555 555 1111",
    "SecondaryPhone": "+1 555 555 2222",
    "SendEmails": false,
    "SignupDate": "2014-10-30T00:00:00.0000000+00:00",
    "SponsorId": 1,
    "TaxExemptId": "11-ASDF-1234",
    "TaxId": "152-55-6765",
    "TermsAccepted": true,
    "TextPhone": "+1 555 555 1111",
    "Username": "myUsername",
    "WebAlias": "hello-world-web-alias"
  }
]

404.description: No Customers with the given parameter were found.

500.description:
Something went wrong... Here are some possible reasons for this error:
- Is the model being sent to the API incorrect?
- Did you forget a required field?
- Is the API marked as deprecated, and the date has expired?

If the answer is "No" to all of these questions, DirectScale could be experiencing technical difficulties. Please contact your DirectScale representative if the issue persists.

post.description:
Creates a new Customer based on a valid Customer object.

**Date + Time format** Year-Month-Day'T'MilitaryTimeHour:Minute:Second - Ex. 2018-10-30T15:47:52

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
**Required Fields (based on customerType):** - BirthDate (1) - Get Customer - CustomerType (1, 2, 3) - Get Customer - DefaultShippingAddress (1) - street1 - PostalCode - City - CountryCode - EmailAddress (1, 2, 3) - Get Customer - FirstName (1, 2, 3) - Get Customer - LastName (1, 2, 3) - Get Customer - Password (1, 2) - PrimaryAddress (1, 2, 3) - street1 - Region - CountryCode - SponsorId (1, 2, 3) - Get Customer - TaxId (1) - Get Customer - TermsAccepted (1) - Username (1, 2, 3) - Get Customer Uniqueness Required: - BackOfficeId - EmailAddress - TaxId - Username - WebAlias **NOTE:** Unique variables can be validated with our **Validate** API calls.

Note: Many of the property's behaviors can be changed by the implementation of the commission plan to allow the property to be optional or have different uniqueness characteristics. Please contact your support representative for specific details.

201.description: Signifies that the Customer was created successfully.

500.description:
Something went wrong... Here are some possible reasons for this error:
- Is the model being sent to the API incorrect?
- Did you forget a required field?
- Is the API marked as deprecated, and the date has expired?

If the answer is "No" to all of these questions, DirectScale could be experiencing technical difficulties. Please contact your DirectScale representative if the issue persists.

get.description:
Retrieves a Customer based on a valid Customer Id.

You can get the **Request Parameter** at these calls:

**customerId**
- Get Customer IDs
- Get Customer IDs by Filter

parameters.name: customerId
parameters.description: The Id of the Customer to retrieve.

200.description: Returns a valid Customer object.

404.description: A Customer with the given Customer ID was not found.

500.description:
Something went wrong... Here are some possible reasons for this error:
- Is the model being sent to the API incorrect?
- Did you forget a required field?
- Is the API marked as deprecated, and the date has expired?

If the answer is "No" to all of these questions, DirectScale could be experiencing technical difficulties. Please contact your DirectScale representative if the issue persists.

put.description:
Updates an existing Customer's information.

Note: This call requires an update to all of the Customer's information. Therefore, if a field is omitted or remains blank, the update will clear out the existing information. If only a partial update is desired, please use the PATCH Update Customer API call.

You can get the **Request Parameter** at these calls: **customerId** - Get Customer IDs - Get Customer IDs by Filter

parameters.name: customerId
parameters.description: The ID of the Customer to update.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
All Fields are Required WARNING: If a field is omitted or remains blank, the update will clear out the existing information.

All variables can be found using **Get Customer** and **Get Customers by Parameter**. - BirthDate - CompanyName - CustomerStatus - CustomerType - DefaultShippingAddress - Street1 - Street2 - City - Region - PostalCode - CountryCode - EmailAddress - ExternalReferenceId - FirstName - LanguageCode - LastName - PrimaryAddress - Street1 - Street2 - City - Region - PostalCode - CountryCode - PrimaryPhone - SecondaryPhone - SponsorId - TaxExemptId - TextPhone

200.description: The Customer was updated correctly.

404.description: A Customer with the given Customer ID was not found.

500.description:
Something went wrong... Here are some possible reasons for this error:
- Is the model being sent to the API incorrect?
- Did you forget a required field?
- Is the API marked as deprecated, and the date has expired?

If the answer is "No" to all of these questions, DirectScale could be experiencing technical difficulties. Please contact your DirectScale representative if the issue persists.

delete.description:
Deletes a Customer (and all peripheral data) based on a valid Customer Id.

You can get the **Request Parameter** at these calls: **customerId** - Get Customer IDs - Get Customer IDs by Filter

parameters.name: customerId
parameters.description: The Id of the Customer to delete.

200.description: The Customer was successfully deleted.

404.description: A Customer with the given Customer ID was not found.

500.description:
Something went wrong... Here are some possible reasons for this error:
- Is the model being sent to the API incorrect?
- Did you forget a required field?
- Is the API marked as deprecated, and the date has expired?

If the answer is "No" to all of these questions, DirectScale could be experiencing technical difficulties. Please contact your DirectScale representative if the issue persists.

patch.description:
Updates an existing Customer's information.

Note: This call updates only the Customer's information that is passed in. If the variable desired is part of an array of variables, then the rest of the variables must be included. If a complete update is desired, then please use the PUT Update Customer API call.

You can get the **Request Parameter** at these calls: **customerId** - Get Customer IDs - Get Customer IDs by Filter **Date + Time format** Year-Month-Day'T'MilitaryTimeHour:Minute:Second - Ex. 2020-02-20T15:47:52

parameters.name: customerId
parameters.description: The ID of the Customer to update.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Include only the fields needed for the Customer update. Supported Fields: - WebAlias - Username - CustomerType - CustomerStatus - BirthDate - CompanyName - EmailAddress - PrimaryAddress (All Address properties must be specified: Street1, Street2, City, Region, PostalCode, CountryCode) - DefaultShippingAddress (All Address properties must be specified: Street1, Street2, City, Region, PostalCode, CountryCode) - FirstName - LanguageCode - LastName - PrimaryPhone - SecondaryPhone - TaxId - TextPhone

200.description: The Customer was updated successfully.

404.description: A Customer with the given Customer ID was not found.

500.description:
Something went wrong... Here are some possible reasons for this error:
- Is the model being sent to the API incorrect?
- Did you forget a required field?
- Is the API marked as deprecated, and the date has expired?

If the answer is "No" to all of these questions, DirectScale could be experiencing technical difficulties. Please contact your DirectScale representative if the issue persists.

Retrieves an array of Orders based on a valid Customer Id.

You can get the **Request Parameter** at these calls:

**customerId**

- Get Customer IDs by Filter

parameters.name: customerId

404.description: A Customer with the given Customer ID was not found.

500.description:
Something went wrong... Here are some possible reasons for this error:
- Is the model being sent to the API incorrect?
- Did you forget a required field?
- Is the API marked as deprecated, and the date has expired?

If the answer is "No" to all of these questions, DirectScale could be experiencing technical difficulties. Please contact your DirectScale representative if the issue persists.

post.description:
Creates an Order for the given Customer Id.

You can get the **Request Parameter** at these calls: **customerId** - Get Customer IDs - Get Customer IDs by Filter

parameters.name: customerId
parameters.description: The Id of the customer for whom an order will be created.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
Required Fields: - CurrencyCode - **Get Regions** displays the country/state codes of the warehouses. If you are concerned about having the proper CurrencyCode, then this will allow you to know what region warehouse support team to call to get the confirmed CurrencyCode. - Items* - Products: Get Item by Filter - Products: Get Item by SKU - Products: Get Item by Id - Payments* - ShipMethodId - Orders: Get Shipping Methods - ShippingAddress - Get Customer - StoreId - Products: Get Stores OnFileCard Options: - Unknown - DoNotSave - Primary - Secondary - OneTimeUse
* At least one object must be present in the array.

201.description: Signifies that the Order was created successfully.

404.description: A Customer with the given Customer ID was not found.

500.description:
Something went wrong... Here are some possible reasons for this error:
- Is the model being sent to the API incorrect?
- Did you forget a required field?
- Is the API marked as deprecated, and the date has expired?

If the answer is "No" to all of these questions, DirectScale could be experiencing technical difficulties. Please contact your DirectScale representative if the issue persists.

get.description:
Provides a collection of commission metrics and statistical information for a given customer.

You can get the **Request Parameter** at these calls:

**customerid**
- Get Customer IDs
- Get Customer IDs by Filter

**Date Format**

Year-Month-Day
- Ex. 2018-10-30

parameters.name: customerid
parameters.description: The Id of the Customer whose Stats are to be retrieved.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: The Date up to which the Stats will be gathered. The default is Today.

200.description: Returns a valid Stats object.

404.description: A Customer with the given Customer ID was not found.

500.description:
Something went wrong... Here are some possible reasons for this error:
- Is the model being sent to the API incorrect?
- Did you forget a required field?
- Is the API marked as deprecated, and the date has expired?

If the answer is "No" to all of these questions, DirectScale could be experiencing technical difficulties. Please contact your DirectScale representative if the issue persists.

get.description: DEPRECATED: Please use the Validate Username API instead.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: The username to check for uniqueness.

200.description: null

post.description: This method provides an aggregate process for: - Creating a new Customer - Placing an initial Order - Enrolling the new Customer in the Autoship process (optional) It also places the new Customer within the proper position in commission plan. **Date + Time format** Year-Month-Day'T'MilitaryTimeHour:Minute:Second - Ex. 2018-10-30T15:47:52 NOTE: Because of the number of steps in this process the latency for this call can be extremely high. It may take 10 to 15 seconds depending on the implementation and complexity of the client's commission plan.

schema.example:
{
    "Order": {
      "ShipMethodID": 2,
      "StoreID": 1,
      "CurrencyCode": "usd",
      "Items": [
        {
          "ItemID": 17901,
          "Quantity": 3,
          "IsKit": true,
          "CurrencyCode": "usd"
        }
      ],
      "Payments": [
        {
          "Amount": 40.79,
          "SavePaymentMethodId": "Usual",
          "OnFileCard": "DoNotSave",
          "CurrencyCode": "usd",
          "MerchantId": 99,
          "SavePayment": true,
          "OrderRewardPoints": {
            "Amount": 25
          },
          "OrderCreditCard": {
            "CardToken": "1254",
            "NameOnCard": "John Doe",
            "Last4": "7689",
            "CardType": "Visa",
            "ExpirationMonth": 2,
            "ExpirationYear": 54
          }
        }
      ],
      "RequireSuccess": true
    },
    "AutoShip": {
      "StartDate": "2020-03-13T19:40:51.126Z",
      "Frequency": "Weekly",
       "ShipMethodID": 3,
      "Items": [
        {
          "ItemID": 17901,
          "Quantity": 2,
          "IsKit": true,
          "CurrencyCode": "usd"
        }
      ]
    },
    "AssociateID": 0,
    "AcceptTerms": true,
    "FirstName": "John",
    "LastName": "Doe Sr.",
    "RomanizedFirstName": "Johnathon",
    "RomanizedLastName": "Doevicus",
    "LegalFirstName": "John",
    "LegalLastName": "Doe",
    "TaxID": "142-67-1234",
    "BirthDate": "2000-03-13T19:40:51.127Z",
    "PrimaryPhone": "123-456-7890",
    "SecondaryPhone": "098-765-4321",
    "TextNumber": "123-456-7890",
    "Email": "johndoe@provider.com",
    "Username": "JonDoseph",
    "Password": "!SneakyJohnDoe1",
    "LanguageCode": "en",
    "ApplicantAddress": {
        "Street1": "7432 Maytown Road",
        "Street2": "",
        "Street3": "",
        "City": "Springfield",
        "Region": "NT",
        "PostalCode": "49007",
        "CountryCode": "US"
    },
    "AssociateTypeID": 0,   // Obsolete, use AssociateBaseType
    "AssociateBaseType": 2,
    "SponsorID": 2,
    "WebPageURL": "www.link.com",
    "WebPageItemID": 45634,
    "SendEmails": true
}

parameters.description:
NOTE:This request creates a customer, an order, and an autoship. For this to work, you'll need to change the item codes to match what's in your system, along with sponsor ID and payment information. For the required fields, calls are provided to see examples of the values the variables should be. Required Fields: - Order - ShipMethodID - Orders: Get Shipping Methods - StoreID - Products: Get Stores - CurrencyCode - **Get Regions** displays the country/state codes of the warehouses. If you are concerned about having the proper **CurrencyCode**, then this will allow you to know what region warehouse support team to call to get the confirmed **CurrencyCode**. - Items - ItemID - Products: Get Item by SKU - Products: Get Items by Filter - Quantity - Payments - CurrencyCode - **Get Regions** displays the country/state codes of the warehouses. If you are concerned about having the proper **CurrencyCode**, then this will allow you to know what region warehouse support team to call to get the confirmed **CurrencyCode**. - MerchantId - Get Payment Merchants - OrderCreditCard - ExpirationMonth - AutoShip - StartDate - ShipMethodID - Orders: Get Shipping Methods - Items - ItemID - Products: Get Item by SKU - Products: Get Items by Filter - Quantity - FirstName - LastName - Email - Username - Password - ApplicantAddress - Street1 - City - Region - PostalCode - CountryCode - AssociateBaseType - SponsorID - Get Customer - Get Customer by Parameter Uniqueness Required: - TaxID - Username **NOTE:** Unique variables can be validated with our **Validate** API calls.
*AcceptTerms may not be required based on the logic surrounding CustomerType.
**At least one object must be present in the array.

201.description: Signifies that the Customer Enrollment was created successfully.

500.description:
Something went wrong... Here are some possible reasons for this error:
- Is the model being sent to the API incorrect?
- Did you forget a required field?
- Is the API marked as deprecated, and the date has expired?

If the answer is "No" to all of these questions, DirectScale could be experiencing technical difficulties. Please contact your DirectScale representative if the issue persists.

post.description:
Calculates a Customer Order Total based on a valid Customer Order object.

You can get the **Request Parameter** at these calls: **customerId** - Get Customer IDs - Get Customer IDs by Filter

parameters.name: customerId
parameters.description: The ID of the Customer whose Order Total is to be calculated.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Required Fields: - CurrencyCode - **Get Regions** displays the country/state codes of the warehouses. If you are concerned about having the proper **CurrencyCode**, then this will allow you to know what region warehouse support team to call to get the confirmed **CurrencyCode**. - ShipMethodId - Get ShippingMethod(s) - ShippingAddress - Get Customer - ItemId - Products: Get Item by ID - Products: Get Item by Filter - Quantity - Amount of the item wanted to be purchased

200.description: Returns a calculated Order Total.

Items.Description: This is a great decorative item featuring a lovely Lady Bug.

404.description: A Customer with the given Customer ID was not found.

500.description:
Something went wrong... Here are some possible reasons for this error:
- Is the model being sent to the API incorrect?
- Did you forget a required field?
- Is the API marked as deprecated, and the date has expired?

If the answer is "No" to all of these questions, DirectScale could be experiencing technical difficulties. Please contact your DirectScale representative if the issue persists.

post.description:
Creates an Autoship Order for the given Customer ID.

If the ShippingAddress is not included in the json or set to null then the default shipping address for the customer will be used.

You can get the **Request Parameter** at these calls: **customerId** - Get Customer IDs - Get Customer IDs by Filter

parameters.name: customerId
parameters.description: The ID of the Customer for whom an Autoship Order will be created.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
Creates an autoship for the CustomerID provided in the URL.

**Required Fields:**
- StartDate
- ShipMethodId
- Items
   - ItemId
- ShipAddress
   - Street1
   - City
   - Region
   - PostalCode
   - CountryCode

201.description: Signifies that the Autoship Order was created successfully.

404.description: A Customer with the given Customer ID was not found.

500.description:
Something went wrong... Here are some possible reasons for this error:
- Is the model being sent to the API incorrect?
- Did you forget a required field?
- Is the API marked as deprecated, and the date has expired?

If the answer is "No" to all of these questions, DirectScale could be experiencing technical difficulties. Please contact your DirectScale representative if the issue persists.

get.description:
Retrieves an array of Customer Parties based on a valid Customer ID and Party Status.

PREVIEW: Please note that this method is still under development.
You can get the **Request Parameters** at these calls: **customerId** - Get Customer IDs - Get Customer IDs by Filter **partyStatus** - Get Customer Party Totals **partyStatus Options:** - Open - Closed - Awarded

parameters.name: customerId
parameters.description: The ID of the Customer whose Parties are to be retrieved.

parameters.name: partyStatus
parameters.description: The Party Status used to retrieve the Customer Parties.

200.description: Returns an array of valid Party objects.

examples.application/json:
[
  {
    "PartyId": 25,
    "CustomerId": 20625,
    "Description": "Test party at my house!",
    "HostId": 20625,
    "HostEmail": "testing@testing.directscale.com",
    "AwardedDate": "2017-02-25T00:00:00.0000000+00:00",

    "EndDate": "2017-02-21T00:00:00.0000000+00:00",

    "PartyDate": "0001-01-01T00:00:00.0000000+00:00",
    "StartTime": "2020-03-12T10:00:00.0000000+00:00",
    "EndTime": "2020-03-12T12:30:00.0000000+00:00",

      "ID": 1,

put.description:
Updates the password of the customer designated.

You can get the **Request Parameter** at these calls:

**customerId**
- Get Customer IDs
- Get Customer IDs by Filter

parameters.name: customerId
parameters.description: The Id of the Customer whose password is to be reset.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Required Fields: - newPassword

200.description: The Customer Password was reset successfully.

404.description: A Customer with the given Customer ID was not found.

500.description:
Something went wrong... Here are some possible reasons for this error:
- Is the model being sent to the API incorrect?
- Did you forget a required field?
- Is the API marked as deprecated, and the date has expired?

If the answer is "No" to all of these questions, DirectScale could be experiencing technical difficulties. Please contact your DirectScale representative if the issue persists.

get.description:
Retrieves custom website information for the given Web Alias.

You can get the **Request Parameter** at this call:

- Get Customer

parameters.name: webAlias
parameters.description: The web alias / subdomain used for fetching a customer's personal website.

application/json.AboutMe: Follow the clues to find out...

get.description:
Retrieves an list of PaymentMethods for the given Customers for the given Store.

You can get the **Request Parameters** at these calls: **customerid** - Get Customer IDs - Get Customer IDs by Filter **storeId** - Products: Get Stores

parameters.name: customerid
parameters.description: The Id of the Customer to retrieve payment methods for.

parameters.name: storeid
parameters.description: The ID of the store to get available payment methods for.

200.description: Returns an array of payment methods.

post.description:
Create a new payment method for the given customer.

NOTE; This operation is only available on Disco version 10 or later.

You can get the **Request Parameters** at these calls: **customerid** - Get Customer IDs - Get Customer IDs by Filter **Date + Time format** Year-Month-Day'T'MilitaryTimeHour:Minute:Second - Ex. 2018-10-30T15:47:52

parameters.name: customerid
parameters.description: The Id of the Customer to create a payment method for.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description:
**Required Fields:**
- **MerchantId**
   - Get Payment Merchants
- **Expires**
   - _Expiration Date of the card_

201.description: Returns the payment method ID for the new payment method that was created.

delete.description:
Delete the given payment method for this customer.

Note: You must also provide the merchant id for the given payment method.

You can get the **Request Parameters** at these calls: **customerid** - Get Customer IDs - Get Customer IDs by Filter **paymentmethodid** - Get Payment Method by Parameters **merchantid** - Get Payment Merchants

parameters.name: customerid
parameters.description: The Id of the customer to delete the payment method for.

parameters.name: paymentmethodid
parameters.description: The payment method Id of the payment to delete.

parameters.name: merchantid
parameters.description: The ID of the merchant that the payment method is assigned to.

200.description: Payment method was removed from the system.

get.description:
Get the data to display a iFrame for hosting the payment data capture form for the given store.

You can get the **Request Parameters** at these calls: **customerid** - Get Customer IDs - Get Customer IDs by Filter **iframeId** - Not sourced by DirectScale **storeId** - Products: Get Stores **countryCode**, **Region**, and **languageCode** - Products: Get Regions

parameters.name: customerid
parameters.description: The Id of the Customer to setup the iframe data for.

parameters.name: iframeid
parameters.description: The HTML tag ID of the frame to be displayed.

parameters.name: storeid
parameters.description: The ID of the Store to capture the payment method for.

parameters.name: countrycode
parameters.description: Two digit Country code.

parameters.name: region
parameters.description: Two digit Region/State/Province code.

parameters.name: languagecode
parameters.description: Two digit Language code

200.description: Returns data for hosting an iFrame payment capture form.

get.description:
Get the data to display a iFrame for hosting the payment data capture form for the given store.

This will also create a temporary customer/associate account. The customer ID is returned in the response body. The Customer Id can be used to save payment method data and submit a enrollment order. The account will not be visible to other areas of the system until the submit enrollment is called. If the enrollment is never processed, then the account will automatically be removed from the system.

You can get the **Request Parameters** at these calls: **iframeId** - Not sourced by DirectScale **storeId** - Products: Get Stores **countryCode**, **region**, and **languageCode** - Products: Get Regions

parameters.name: iframeid
parameters.description: The HTML tag ID of the frame to be displayed.

parameters.name: storeid
parameters.description: The ID of the Store to capture the payment method for.

parameters.name: countrycode
parameters.description: Two digit Country code.

parameters.name: region
parameters.description: Two digit Region/State/Province code.

parameters.name: languagecode
parameters.description: Two digit Language code.

200.description: Returns data for hosting an iFrame payment capture form.

get.description:
Get a list of merchants that can accept payment methods for the given store, country, and language.

You can get the **Request Parameters** at these calls: **customerid** - Get Customer IDs - Get Customer IDs by Filter **storeId** - Products: Get Stores **CountryCode** - Products: Get Regions **Region** - Products: Get Regions

parameters.name: customerid
parameters.description: The ID of the Customer to get a list of merchants for.

parameters.name: storeid
parameters.description: The ID of the Store to retrieve merchants for.

parameters.name: countrycode
parameters.description: Two digit Country code.

parameters.name: region
parameters.description: Two digit Region/State/Province code.

get.description:
Search for all associates that match the given search term.

Within the searchTerm parameter, the following values can be searched and will return all variable values associated with that variable name:
- backOfficeId
- externalId
- emailAddress
- firstName
- lastName
- legalFirstName
- legalLastName
- romanizedFirstName
- romanizedLastName
- textNumber
- primaryPhone
- address1
- city
- state
- zip

parameters.name: searchTerm
parameters.description: The search term used for look up.

200.description: Search items returned.

500.description:
Something went wrong... Here are some possible reasons for this error:
- Is the model being sent to the API incorrect?
- Did you forget a required field?
- Is the API marked as deprecated, and the date has expired?

If the answer is "No" to all of these questions, DirectScale could be experiencing technical difficulties. Please contact your DirectScale representative if the issue persists.

get.description:
Retrieves an array of Active Services on a valid Customer Id.

You can get the **Request Parameter** at these calls:

**customerid**
- Get Customer IDs
- Get Customer IDs by Filter

parameters.name: customerid
parameters.description: The Id of the Customer for whom Orders are to be retrieved.

200.description: Returns an array of valid Service objects.

examples.application/json:
X-DirectScale-RequestId: c0ebc134-bbbf-43c2-8aa1-628c14052387
Date: Tue, 17 Mar 2020 20:32:08 GMT
Content-Length: 362
Content-Type: application/json

[{
  "ServiceName": "Tech Package",
  "CustomerId": 2,
  "ServiceId": 1,
  "ExpirationDate": "2020-03-06T00:00:00",
  "Services": [{
    "ServiceId": 1,
    "ItemId": 17943,
    "ServicePeriod": 1,
    "ServicePeriodType": "Months",
    "GracePeriod": 0,
    "CreateAutoship": true
  }]
}]

put.description:
Updates the Last Charge Amount and Next Process Date of the given AutoShip.


You can get the **Request Parameter** at this call:

**autoshipId**
- Get Customer Autoships

parameters.name: autoshipId

500.description:
Something went wrong... Here are some possible reasons for this error:
- Is the model being sent to the API incorrect?

get.description:
For a given date/time range, fetch all notification events generated by customer events. The "notification type" is an integer. Its values could vary by client if overridden, but the default list is as follows:

        Enrollment = 0,
        RankAdvancement = 1,
        NewOrder = 2,
        NewAutoOrder = 3,
        CommissionStatChanged = 4,
        AutoShipProcessFailure = 5

**Date + Time format**

Year-Month-Day'T'MilitaryTimeHour:Minute:Second
- Ex. 2018-10-30T15:47:52

parameters.name: beginDate
parameters.description: Begin date of notification range

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: End date of notification range

post.description:
Create a service log entry for the given customer.

This appears on the customer record.

Passing in a Message results in only a service log entry. Passing in both Message and Detailed Message creates the service log entry, and a (linked) related support record with greater detail. You can get the **Request Parameter** at these calls: **customerid** - Get Customer IDs - Get Customer IDs by Filter

parameters.name: customerid
parameters.description: The Id of the Customer

201.description: Returns the payment method ID for the new payment method that was created.

get.description:
Retrieves an array of Autoships based on a valid Customer Id.

You can get the **Request Parameter** at these calls:

**customerId**
- Get Customer IDs
- Get Customer IDs by Filter

parameters.name: customerId
parameters.description: The Id of the Customer for whom Autoships are to be retrieved.

parameters.name: includeServiceAutoships
parameters.description: Some autoships are related to services like website access. By default, these will be included. To only retrieve non-service autoships, pass "false".

200.description: Returns an array of valid Order objects.
